channel.title: Dictionaries :: Introduction to Python
channel.description: YouTube Video Resources Slides In theory, a dictionary is very similar to a list in Python - it is a data structure that can store many different items within a single variable. However, instead of just storing single values as elements and assigning them sequential indexes, dictionaries store a number of key-value pairs. A key is any value that can be used as a unique identifier for the associated value to be stored in the dictionary.
